namespace.tagUsage: Contains the front matter of the song
Contains the title of the song
Contains the body of the song
Marks part of the song sung by the same singer(s)
Marks a sub-section of the song (verse, chorus, etc). @copyOf attribute is used to indicate repeated sub-sections. @corresp attribute is used to link French and English versions of sub-sections
Marks a metrical line. @corresp attribute is used to link French and English versions of lines.
Marks a reference to an external resource

projectDesc.p: What is Digital Humanities? The Album

lg.l: Huma-Num point f rHuma-Num and its associated website https://huma-num.fr provides digital research infrastructure for French-speaking researchers in the social sciences and humanities. See https://documentation.huma-num.fr/humanum-en/.
Huma-Num point f r
Au soleil, sous la pluie
À midi ou à minuit
Il y a tout ce que vous voulez sur
Huma-Num
Une infrastructure de recherche
Avec étoile,In France very large research infrastructures, such as Huma-Num, are denoted IR* (infrastructure de recherche étoile). aussi une perche
(Le marque de son moteur de recherche, Isidore)
Et Isidore est un poisson
Qui trouve les données et moisonne
En Espagnol, Anglais,

Et bien sur en Francais.The search engine Isidore (https://isidore.science) harvests social science and humanities data and documents in French, Spanish, and English, and enriches them with standardised metadata. These can be accessed via a keyword search or as Linked Data via a SPARQL endpoint. See https://isidore.science/about.
Pour partager et publier,
et valoriser vos données
Vous pouvez utiliser l’entrepôt Nakala.The data warehouse Nakala is another service provided by Huma-Num. See https://www.nakala.fr/about.

Attribué un DOIData or documents made publically available in Nakala are automatically assigned a Document Object Identifier (DOI). See https://documentation.huma-num.fr/nakala/#attribution-dun-doi-a-une-donnee-publique.
Accès aussi par APINakala can be accessed via API if one has a HumanID account, the centralised authentication service for Huma-Num. See https://documentation.huma-num.fr/nakala/#depot-par-lapi.

Public, privée, metadonnées! Le koala a tout.When depositing data in Nakala, one can choose to make it public or private. Nakala also supports the Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting (OAI-PMH). The logo of Nakala is a koala. See https://documentation.huma-num.fr/nakala/#moissonnage-des-metadonnees

Huma-Num dot f rHuma-Num and its associated website https://huma-num.fr provides digital research infrastructure for French-speaking researchers in the social sciences and humanities. See https://documentation.huma-num.fr/humanum-en/.
Huma-Num dot f r
In the sun, in the rain
At midnight or midday
There's everything that you could want at
Huma-Num.
A research infrastructure
With a star,In France very large research infrastructures, such as Huma-Num, are denoted IR* (infrastructure de recherche étoile). and a perch too
(The logo of its search engine, Isidore)
And Isidore is a fish
Who finds data and harvests it
In Spanish, English,

And of course in French.The search engine Isidore (https://isidore.science) harvests social science and humanities data and documents in French, Spanish, and English, and enriches them with standardised metadata. These can be accessed via a keyword search or as Linked Data via a SPARQL endpoint. See https://isidore.science/about.
To share and publish
And enrich your data
You can use the Nakala repository.The data warehouse Nakala is another service provided by Huma-Num. See https://www.nakala.fr/about.

Get assigned a DOIData or documents made publicly available in Nakala are automatically assigned a Document Object Identifier (DOI). See https://documentation.huma-num.fr/nakala/#attribution-dun-doi-a-une-donnee-publique.
Access via APINakala can be accessed via API if one has a HumanID account, the centralised authentication service for Huma-Num. See https://documentation.huma-num.fr/nakala/#depot-par-lapi

Public, private, metadata! The koala has it all.When depositing data in Nakala, one can choose to make it public or private. Nakala also supports the Open Archives Initiative Protocol for Metadata Harvesting (OAI-PMH). The logo of Nakala is a koala. See https://documentation.huma-num.fr/nakala/#moissonnage-des-metadonnees
